question: Question_08
hints:
We write down what it means for $f$ to be continuous. This is given by

\begin{align*}
\lim_{x\rightarrow t^-} f(x) &= \lim_{x\rightarrow t^+} f(x)\\
e^{-t}&=2(t+1)\end{align*}

In order for our function to be continuous, we need a solution to the
above equation. Now we can apply the hint in the problem to use the
intermediate value theorem.
